answer: Comprehensive oral examination. This service is typically available on a periodic basis, usually once within a defined interval.
Consultation provided for urgent or specific oral health concerns requiring immediate attention.
Use of protective safety equipment by clinical staff during patient interaction to maintain hygiene and safety standards.
Use of properly sterilised clinical instruments required to safely perform dental procedures.
Diagnostic intra-oral imaging used to assess specific areas. Usage limits may apply based on clinical guidelines.
